article.headline: Portland State 79, Montana State 65
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Scott Morrison scored 17 points and grabbed 10 rebounds to lead Portland State to a 79-65 basketball win over Montana State on Saturday night. Paul Hafford came off the bench to score 15 points for the Vikings (10-5, 1-1), while Deonte Huff added 14 points for Portland State. Carson Durr and Carlos Taylor each had 14 points to lead Montana State (4-11, 1-1). Casey Durham chipped in 13 points for the Bobcats. After leading 41-32 at halftime, Portland State hit three 3-pointers in the first six minutes of the second half and built a 52-40 lead when Hafford connected beyond the arc with 14:34 left to play. The Vikings led by as many as 16 points in the second half and held off a late Bobcat rally to claim their first league victory of the season. Portland State shot 44 percent from the field for the game and outscored Montana State 34-18 in the paint. Montana State, after shooting 48 percent in the first half, struggled in the second half at just 33 percent.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
